pullRequest.body:
Make sure that `Function.Injective.somethingRing` looks like
```
def ... : SomethingRing β where
  toA := hf.a f ...
  __ := hf.b f ...
  __ := hf.c f ...
```
  if `SomethingRing α extends A α, B α, C α`.

This should hopefully give a performance boost in applications.

Incidentally, there were a few missing transfer definitions, so I added them as I needed them.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: I mean here
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/53d01547-ae0e-4c50-9a19-b0c9d34cf8a5) for commit 0845f1bb744968422d50aeb5791b799e62fcb674.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/0a2a18e7-c816-4958-b51d-fcb4bf0c4bb2/to/53d01547-ae0e-4c50-9a19-b0c9d34cf8a5) against commit b2f1824c1d0f700719b7c432e34bd29f75cd0300:
```diff
  Benchmark                                           Metric         Change
  =========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.Module.PID                         instructions     5.4%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.FunctionField            instructions    18.2%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.GammaSpecAdjunction      instructions     9.9%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Properties               instructions    28.9%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Spec                     instructions    10.0%
+ ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.AbelRuffini                    instructions   -25.3%
+ ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.FractionalIdeal   instructions    -9.4%
+ ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.RamificationInertia           instructions    -3.4%
```
Seems to be slightly better overall, but nothing crazy.
What happens if you also change the instances in `RingTheory.Subring.Basic`?

What do you mean exactly? There's no such instances in `RingTheory.Subring.Basic`. There's a few uses of transfer instances for ordered rings, so I changed those as well, but I'm not sure that's what you meant.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/63d74f59-2dd4-41e1-959f-03754a60a8d0) for commit c3c3d3a09bd26af4db5b4411bbbea11e539ad2e4.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/0a2a18e7-c816-4958-b51d-fcb4bf0c4bb2/to/63d74f59-2dd4-41e1-959f-03754a60a8d0) against commit b2f1824c1d0f700719b7c432e34bd29f75cd0300:
```diff
  Benchmark                                           Metric         Change
  =========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.Module.PID                         instructions     5.4%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.FunctionField            instructions    18.2%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.GammaSpecAdjunction      instructions     9.9%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Properties               instructions    28.9%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Spec                     instructions    10.0%
+ ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.AbelRuffini                    instructions   -25.3%
- ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.Subfield                       instructions    15.3%
+ ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.FractionalIdeal   instructions    -9.3%
+ ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.RamificationInertia           instructions    -3.4%
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.Subring.Basic                   instructions    12.1%
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.Subsemiring.Basic               instructions    22.8%
```

I think that was a good interpretation. What I had in mind is probably out of scope here. It looks like #8386 will get in later today so let's wait until we can bench against that also. As both PRs have slowdowns around instances `subX`'s, just want to be safe. (Who knows they might cancel each other out.)

In the meantime, are there any other transfer lemmas hiding in the repo?
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/c69c3b53-6eb9-40af-adb0-0ce39280c27b) for commit faa6a0b370dad16847ebfe884d9e765144f8e5d5.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/78e16879-2c25-48d7-9b7e-109ddd989a99/to/c69c3b53-6eb9-40af-adb0-0ce39280c27b) against commit ef34249cd47a1855306e4b08f6f54db54e86b412:
```diff
  Benchmark                                           Metric         Change
  =========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.FunctionField            instructions    18.7%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.GammaSpecAdjunction      instructions    10.0%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Properties               instructions    27.4%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Spec                     instructions     8.6%
+ ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.AbelRuffini                    instructions   -33.4%
+ ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.Adjoin                         instructions    -4.1%
- ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.Subfield                       instructions    17.8%
+ ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.FractionalIdeal   instructions   -10.3%
+ ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.RamificationInertia           instructions    -2.8%
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.Subring.Basic                   instructions    14.3%
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.Subsemiring.Basic               instructions    28.1%
```

Let's just do it all together here. 

bors merge
:-1: Rejected by label
For the record, yes there's plenty more: `Field`, `Module`, `Lattice`...
Do you want to pull those in or just merge?
I will do them when I have time, which will be in about a week, so let's just merge now.
bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7821023366/job/21337062411)

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7821414788/job/21338304280)
bors r-
Canceled.
bors d+

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
@mattrobball, do you understand what's going on here?
[Yes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/5df475b9-b2c3-4b42-b86b-144d5bfcb847)
Hmm. I also had it narrowed down to a particular `CommRing` instance that took forever in unification but I appear to have misplaced that commit.

Ok, found it. `FractionalIdeal.commSemiring`. We can hackily fix the timeouts with 
```lean
attribute [-instance] FractionalIdeal.commSemiring in
 theorem exists_ne_zero_mem_ringOfIntegers_of_norm_le_mul_sqrt_discr :
```
and 
```lean
attribute [-instance] FractionalIdeal.commSemiring
 variable (w₁ : InfinitePlace K) {B : ℕ} (hB : minkowskiBound K 1 < (convexBodyLTFactor K) * B)
```

But this doesn't particularly make me happy
I guess it's better than not merging this PR?
I will add some notes and then retry.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/9c99924c-215b-4c3f-a549-d01bf22069f2) for commit bac351860f064f6a272c4a5114a21337c63e7001.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/2f649785-8d9d-4c87-b414-6ee4c61963b7/to/9c99924c-215b-4c3f-a549-d01bf22069f2) against commit 765353a8b532e94e90e394b95462e0a1e613fe56:
```diff
  Benchmark                                           Metric         Change
  =========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.FunctionField            instructions    18.6%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.GammaSpecAdjunction      instructions    10.1%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Properties               instructions    28.1%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Spec                     instructions     9.7%
+ ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.AbelRuffini                    instructions   -33.8%
+ ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.Adjoin                         instructions    -4.5%
- ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.Subfield                       instructions    18.5%
+ ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.FractionalIdeal   instructions   -10.5%
- ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.Units             instructions     7.2%
+ ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.RamificationInertia           instructions    -2.7%
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.Subring.Basic                   instructions    14.7%
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.Subsemiring.Basic               instructions    28.6%
```
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7908087028/job/21586543901)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7908087028/job/21586543080)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7908087028/job/21586543729)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - perf: Use spread notation in ring transfer definitions
